complaint.factual_background: The uploaded file is not an FTC complaint. It is a 54-page legal brief filed by Meta Platforms, Inc. (Respondent) on July 18, 2024, in FTC Docket No. C-4365. The brief responds to FTC Complaint Counsel's reply regarding whether the Commission has authority under Section 5(b) of the FTC Act to reopen and modify a 2020 consent order. Meta argues that Section 5(b) does not authorize modification of consent orders entered without a hearing, that the Commission lacks authority to enforce its own orders or adjudicate order noncompliance, and that the proceeding is unconstitutional under Article III.

provisions.title: Order Directing Further Reply
provisions.summary: Respondent Meta Platforms, Inc. is directed to file a reply addressing the legal issues raised by Complaint Counsel's Reply within thirty days of this order.

requirements.description: Meta Platforms, Inc. must file a reply addressing the legal issues raised by Complaint Counsel's Reply within thirty days of the order.
requirements.quoted_text: IT IS HEREBY ORDERED THAT Respondent Meta Platforms, Inc. is directed to file, within thirty days of this order, a reply addressing the legal issues raised by Complaint Counselâ€™s Reply.
